p.i: The House met at half-past Two o'clock
The following Members took and subscribed the Oath, or made and subscribed the Affirmation required by Law:

ul.li: Dr. David Anthony Llewellyn Owen, Plymouth, Devonport.
Robert Adam Ross Maclennan, esquire, Caithness and Sutherland.
John Dennis Concannon, esquire, Mansfield.
Right honourable Barbara Anne, Mrs. Castle, Blackburn.
Right honourable Norman Harold Lever, Manchester, Central.
Right honourable Judith Constance Mary, Mrs. Hart, Lanark.
Right honourable Stanley Orme, Salford WeSt. John William Gilbert, esquire, Dudley East.
John Ellis, esquire, Brigg and Scunthorpe.

Robert Thomas Boscawen, esquire, MC, commonly called the honourable Robert Thomas Boscawen, Wells.
Dr. Reginald Frederick Brittain Bennett, VRD, Fareham.
Peter Wynford Innes Rees, esquire, QC, Dover and Deal.
Anthony David Steen, esquire, Liverpool, Wavertree.
Alan Michael Clark Hutchison, esquire, Edinburgh South.
Alan Kenneth McKenzie Clark, esquire, commonly called the honourable Alan Kenneth McKenzie Clark, Plymouth, Sutton.

Iain Somerled MacDonald MacCormick, esquire, Argyll.

Timothy Alan Davan Sainsbury, esquire, commonly called the honourable Timothy Alan Davan Sainsbury, Hove.

Roland Dunstan Moyle, esquire, Lewisham East.

speech.p: I suspend the sitting till half-past three o'clock.

p.i: The following Members took and subscribed the Oath, or made and subscribed the Affirmation required by Law:

ul.li: Winston Spencer Churchill, esquire, Stretford.
Jack Ashley, esquire, Stoke-on-Trent South.
Sir Edward Joseph Brown, MBE, Bath.
Clement Raphael Freud, esquire, Isle of Ely.
Cranley Gordon Douglas Onslow, esquire, Woking.
Norman Stewart Hughson Lamont, esquire, Kingston upon Thames.

speech.p: Resolved, That this House do now adjourn till tomorrow at twenty-five minutes past Eleven o'clock.—[Mr. James A. Dunn.]

p.i: Adjourned accordingly at twenty-six minutes to Four o'clock.
